title: 3 tips that will double the size of your transplants when you up pot them - Planting Tomatoes

subtasks: Preparing the work area
Selecting the appropriate size trays for seed starting
Planting cherry tomato seeds in 50-cell flats
Monitoring seedling development and true leaf emergence
Tips for proper up potting
Using egg cups for up potting
Preparing up potting soil mix
Adding pre-plant fertilizer to soil mix
Transplanting seedlings into up potting cups
Watering up potted seedlings with plain water
Conditioning the plants for transplant shock
Introducing organic nitrogen fertilizer after establishment
Observing rapid growth response in tomatoes
Organizing trays and containers for seedlings
Ensuring proper lighting and temperature for germination
Planting seeds at the recommended depth and spacing
Maintaining soil moisture with appropriate watering techniques
Monitoring soil temperature and humidity
Transferring seedling trays to a suitable growing location
Assessing soil nutrient levels
Selecting appropriate soil amendments and fertilizers
Mixing pre-plant fertilizer into the soil
Spreading organic matter over the garden bed
Ensuring good soil aeration and drainage

tasks.task: Gardening Techniques for Transplant Shock Mitigation
subtasks: Proper handling and acclimation of young seedlings
Watering practices for transplanting
Protecting plants from wind and sun stress
Monitoring for signs of transplant shock

tasks.task: After the MAINTASK, I need to list each subtask. Like starting with preparing the work area, selecting trays, planting the seeds, monitoring growth, and so on.
Potting and Up Potting Cherry Tomatoes**
Applying the Three Tips to Grow Tomatoes
subtasks: Tip 1 - Give enough room for growth
Tip 2 - Use same growing medium
Tip 3 - Feed transplant with fertilizer

tasks.task: But maybe it's a general tip, in which case the subtask is implied in MAINTASK1.1.
Subtask something like "Apply fertilizer after establishment". But previously in the up potting process, you have to prepare the mix by adding garden tone.
Appying Three Tips to Grow Tomatoes, each with detailed steps.

subtasks: Preparing trays for planting (50-cell flat, selecting appropriate)
Planting cherry tomato seeds
Monitoring seedling growth and true leaf emergence
Transplanting seedlings into up pot trays (egg cups)
Preparing up potting soil mix (sterile soil + garden tone)
Watering transplanted seedlings with plain water
Observing plants for shock recovery (stagnant growth)
Applying organic nitrogen fertilizer solution (Chilean nitrate) once established
Monitoring for rapid growth

tasks.task: Setting up and Up Potting Tomatoes**
Potting and Up Potting Cherry Tomatoes
subtasks: Choosing appropriate trays (50-cell flat)
Planting cherry tomato seeds
Monitoring seedling development (true leaves emergence)
Transplanting into egg cups (up potting)
Mixing up potting soil (sterile soil + garden tone)
Watering transplanted seedlings with plain water
Fertilizing after establishment with organic nitrogen

tasks.task: Applying Gardening Tips for Tomato Growth
subtasks: Ensuring adequate growing space (not rushing up potting)
Using same soil mix for up potting
Applying fertilizer after transplant shock recovery
